title: Pollinator Identification
description: Used unsupervised machine learning techniques such as principal component analysis to extract layers and identify the most salient features when classifying distinct pollinator species. Used Python, Scikit-learn, Tensorflow, Seaborn, and Pandas.

title: Recipe Analysis
description: Processed tens of thousands of recipes and hundreds of thousands of user interactions to assess and predict which factors are most influential in a recipe’s performance and popularity on Food.com. Performed hypothesis tests to determine significance and used Python, Pandas, Plotly and Scikit-learn to make linear regression and random forest regressor models.

title: Melody RNN
description: Implemented a recurrent neural network to generate simple piano melodies based on Beethoven’s most popular compositions as a final project for COGS 181: Deep Learning and Neural Networks. Used Python, PyTorch, and the music21 library.

title: Predicting Wildfires in California
description: Analyzed wildfires in Northern California and their co-occurrence with precipitation and temperature to find key determinants in predicting wildfires. Used Python, Pandas, Numpy, and Matplotlib to analyze and visualize data.
